data: Restricted to Department of Anesthesiology Pain Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine
Intrathecal analgesia only to be ordered by Anesthesiology, Acute Pain Service (APS) or Pain Anesthesia Chronic Pain Pain Anesthesiology or Pain Medicine
q1h for 18 hours then q4h and PRN q1h for 12 hour then q2h for 12 hour then PRN
q1h for 18 hours then q4h and PRN q1h for 12 hour then q2h for 12 hour then PRN
q1h for 18 hours then q4h and PRN q1h for 12 hour then q2h for 12 hour then PRN
q15min for 1 hour then q30min q1h for 1 hour then q4h and PRN
Monitor bladder distension q6h PRN. Bladder scan or ensure void quantities sufficient q6h
PRN, if bladder distension or urine retention greater than 400 mL or unable to void then perform in / out catheterization
CADD Solis pump is used for intrathecal analgesia on chronic pain patients having intrathecal trial

Discontinue all previous opioid, acetaminophen and NSAID orders. No additional opioids to be given while receiving intrathecal analgesia except by order of Chronic Pain Anesthesia Anesthesiologist or Pain Medicine Palliative Care  Acute Pain Service Pain Anesthesiology , Pain Medicine or Palliative Care Medicine
